title: Yorkshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: m1 southbound closed in west yorkshire after crash .
man hit by truck on slip road at junction 46 .
snow expected on higher parts of yorkshire .
today 's races abandoned at doncaster racecourse .
mountain rescue teams on hand across west yorkshire .

documents.title: anti-slavery agency boss dies aged 54
text: anti-slavery agency boss dies aged 54

documents.title: your weather forecast for this evening
text: any lingering rain clearing during the evening .
it will become cold under clear skies with light winds allowing a widespread frost to develop with a risk of icy patches .

documents.title: police watchdog investigation delayed
text: the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) says an investigation into the death of a man who was shot dead by a west yorkshire police firearms officer wo n't be completed until the conclusion of another case .
yassar yaqub , who was 28 and from huddersfield , was fatally shot in a car stopped near junction 24 of the m62 on 2 january 2017 .
the ipcc say they ca n't complete an investigation into mr yaqub 's death until the trial of another man , which is set for april 2018 , has concluded .

documents.title: campaign to close a19 gaps gathers 3,000 signatures
text: a campaign set up hoping to close gaps on the a19 's central reservation has gained 3,000 signatures .
last year sonia rose , 83 , died on the road near northallerton after after a van veered from the opposite side of the dual carriageway into her path .
the highways agency says it 'll close the gap by march next year .
sonia 's daughter , katy , says it 's important all gaps are closed to save lives .

documents.title: appeal to build rspca small animal centre in sheffield
text: the rspca has launched a new appeal for help to build a centre in sheffield for small animals .
managers at the rspca in the city say they 're `` astounded '' by the growing number of small animals being abandoned or neglected in south yorkshire .
last year about 400 rabbits , gerbils , rats , mice and other animals were up by inspectors across the region .
tony benham , manager of the rspca animal shelter in sheffield says the problem stems from people not getting advice about neutering small animals .

a lot of people when they get a dog or a cat , the majority of people , think about neutering and prevent them having more litters but with small animals they have multiple babies at once , so you start off with two mice and end up with a 150 mice ''

documents.title: over 200 arrested for drink and drug driving this month
text: the number of people arrested for drink and drug driving offences has gone over 200 people across west yorkshire this december .
since the start of the month , 225 people were arrested in total with 45 being drugs related .
32 % of arrests were made between 00:00 and 03:00 , the peak time .
of those charged : 30 from bradford , 22 from kirklees , 41 from leeds , 23 from wakefield and 14 from calderdale .
the figures come as part of the force 's 'not the usual suspects ' campaign which highlights anyone can be a drink or drug driver .

police sgt gary roper of the roads policing support unit said : we are now heading into the new year and i would like to remind people to consider their travelling arrangements if they are out and about celebrating and not to drink or drug drive . ''

documents.title: nostell priory crash fatality named
text: west yorkshire police have released the name of the man who died following a road traffic collision in wakefield .
curtis smith , 26 , from the cudworth area of barnsley , died after his blue peugeot 206 collided with a ford kuga on wakefield road , ackworth .
the driver of the ford , a 59-year-old woman , suffered minor injuries .
in a statement , his family said : `` words can not begin to describe the loss we are all feeling following the tragic accident which claimed curtis 's life on saturday . ''
officers from the major collision enquiry team are continuing to appeal for witnesses to the collision and is asked to call the team on 101 , quoting log 846 of 23 december .

documents.title: car flips over on snow in sheffield
text: car flips over on snow in sheffield

documents.title: terror charge pair remanded in custody
text: a fish-and-chip shop owner and another man have appeared in court accused of preparing to build a bomb in the lead up to christmas .
andy sami star , 31 , of sheffield road , chesterfield , and farhad salah , 22 , of brunswick road , sheffield , are jointly charged with a single count of preparing an act of terrorism .

westminster magistrates court heard that the pair , appearing on a video link from leeds , allegedly researched and prepared bomb ingredients for an attack on the uk and recorded test explosions on a smart phone .
deputy senior district judge ikram tan remanded the pair in custody before they next appear at the old bailey on 19 january .

documents.title: man hit by truck on motorway dies
text: man hit by truck on motorway dies

documents.title: florence , aged 7 , shows spirit of christmas
text: the spirit of christmas is alive and well in scarborough .
as seen here by florence 's gift to police officers on duty over the festive period :
north yorkshire police

documents.title: man , 19 , dies after being hit by truck on m1 slip road
text: a 19-year-old man has died following a fatal road traffic collision on the exit slip road of the m1 southbound .
the incident happened at around 05:00 this morning after a white daf articulated lorry struck a young man at junction 46 southbound on the m1 .
the pedestrian was pronounced dead at the scene by paramedics .
road closures remain in place at this time whilst emergency services continue their investigations .
police are appealing for any witnesses to the collision itself or if anyone saw the pedestrian prior to the collision to contact the police .
drivers in the area at the time with working dash cam footage are asked to contact the major collision enquiry team via 101 quoting log number 192 of 29 december .

documents.title: car crashes into tree in sheffield
text: police are at the scene of an accident on gleadless road in sheffield .
it 's reported that the driver lost control coming down a hill and crashed into a tree .
the road is currently closed :
a man has just flipped his car .
thankfully an ambulance was literally 20 feet away @ twitterid
wowzers !

documents.title: travel : vehicles stuck on east bank road in sheffield
text: vehicles are getting stuck on east bank road in sheffield due to weather conditions .
radio sheffield 's reporter jenny eells has just tweeted this from the scene :
emergency gritters out on east bank road # sheffield .
it is now passable but proceed with caution !
# snow @ twitterid
why are we so bad at this ? ?
oh it 's a merc .
even worse .
check that useless bmw driver spinning away , polishing the slush into ice .
some poor chap using a gloved hand to scrape grit off a shovel !
been there done that
surely better to have a snow ploughclear the remaining snow than someone with a van full of grit ?
what 's an `` emergency '' gritter ?

documents.title: boxing day murder victim was stabbed
text: boxing day murder victim was stabbed

documents.title: did you see vehicle accident in north yorkshire ?
text: officers are appealing for information after a ford mondeo came off the road , leaving the driver with serious injuries .
the incident took place at around 11:00 , 28 december , on the b6270 road between low row and gunnerside in north yorkshire .
the vehicle was found in a field , approximately 50m from the road .
the driver , in man in his 30s from darlington , suffered serious injuries while the passenger , a 17-year-old boy , sustained less serious injuries .

anyone who witnessed the incident is asked to contact north yorkshire police on 101 , select option 2 and ask for richmond roads policing group - quote reference number 12170231022 when passing on information .
or email john.lumbard @ northyorkshire.pnn.police.uk .

documents.title: snow continues to fall across yorkshire
text: it would seem the forecast snow is upon us and it 's covering the majority of yorkshire .
it is n't expected to last for the whole of the day and we could see some sun and rain showers towards the afternoon .
it does , however , leave us with some nice weather watcher - here 's two horses braving the conditions .
and a very calm and peaceful area of holmfirth .
if you 've got anything you 'd like to share with us today then send it to us by clicking here .

documents.title: mountain rescue teams on hand across west yorkshire
text: as the snow continues to fall in areas across west yorkshire , mountain rescue teams are aiding emergency services to help those in need .
in holme valley , they 've been out since the early hours of the morning - so fear not if you 're having difficulties in the higher grounds !
@ twitterid have two fully crewed 4x4 vehicles positioned around our area since 0400 this morning .
here is hvm3 , near diggle .
team members remain on high alert for deployment across west yorkshire .
the lippy is a must !
equipment check carried out - including the red lippy right ? ? ?

documents.title: police urge caution in wintry conditions
text: if you 're on the m62 between greater manchester and west yorkshire , please take care .
pictures from our # me21 @ twitterid j22 m62wb - classic line by driver , do n't know why it skidded as it a 4x4 !
doh !
- please slow down and drive to the conditions .
the laws of physics do n't apply to 4x4 drivers
you should have said some 4x4 drivers '' do n't tar us all with the same brush
oh we certainly do n't tar everyone with the same brush dave .
just asking people to drive the conditions as we want you all to get to your destination safely .
morning .
absolutely !
i 'm waiting for some bright spark to sue the manufacturer because they did n't think the traction control was n't working '' god give me strength !
do n't tar all us audi drivers with the same brush , some of us are sensible and @ considerate to other road users # quattro
coz they are faster cars and the driving standards in this country r absolutely shocking .
no one gives a fuck about anybody else on the road that 's the problem yet everyone moans about traffic and do nothing to help it !
# baddrivers # middlelanewankers
4x4 drivers think they are invincible !
i drive one , and had lessons teaching me how to drive it safely .
but i slow right down in bad weather .
a lot of weight to lose control of
you 're right but a lot of people driving them do n't know how to unfortunately and do n't take lessons like you .
ha ha this conversation re 4x4s cropped up at dinner party tonight .
our friends were saying exactly the same things .
while living in scandinavia lessons were compulsary as were snow tyres & chains .
this was late 60s early 70s .
a good idea on all counts to have lessons , maybe people would n't get so complacent then !
4x4 has better traction in snow but even with traction control the law of physics proves anything will skid providing excess motion is applied
a 2wd car with winter tyres will always outperform a 4x4 with summer tyres in snowy /slushy conditions .
i change my summer tyres to winter in october then back to summer ones in april .
alternatively nokian weatherproof/michelin crossclimates are a good compromise all year round .
6 out of 10 for artistic effort .
4x4 or not - drive like a dick .
just saying

documents.title: today 's races abandoned at doncaster racecourse
text: bad news if you were planning on braving the conditions at heading to the races at doncaster .
they 've been abandoned for today due to the track being frozen and more cold weather to come .
however , if you do have a ticket for today , you 'll be able to up a free grandstand ticket at southwell racecourse .
racing abandoned the track is frozen in places with a deteriorating forecast .
further information to follow .
@ twitterid here we come then
just bring your tickets along with you
if we have tickets for premier enclosure for doncaster , does that allow to get in the premier enclosure at @ twitterid
can you use your tickets at southwell ?
not sure mate .
did n't have tickets as we were with an owner .
anyway can dress down now !
frozen tracking it 's pissing down
good
so why was n't this obvious at the earlier inspection ?
it 's frozen but we might get some warm sun between now and the first race
do the tickets follow on to a future fixture
@ twitterid
awwwwww bugger !
@ twitterid

documents.title: sheffield armed robbery : did you see anything ?
text: south yorkshire police are appealing for any information or witnesses to come forward following an armed robbery in sheffield last week .
the incident took place at around 20:15 on friday 22nd december at the premier store on wolfe road where two armed men entered the shop .
both have been described as white and wearing dark hooded jackets , leaving the convenience store in the direction of browning road .
officers are asking for anyone with any information to contact 101 , or anonymously through crimestoppers on 0800 555 111 , quoting incident number 1048 of 22 december 2017 .

documents.title: train line between west yorkshire and london most delayed in uk
text: new figures looking at train delays show the line which links leeds and wakefield with london is the worst in the country for punctuality .
the data , carried about the consumer association which , shows virgin east coast had the highest number of delays lasting between 30 minutes and two hours this year .
it found that 3.7 % of their services were deemed to be running significantly late .
the association says train companies now need to make it easier for frustrated passengers to claim compensation .

documents.title: have you seen missing patrick thornton ?
text: have you seen missing patrick thornton ?
the 63-year-old went missing on december 22 from the jubilee gardens area of leeds .
mr thornton is described as a white male , about 5ft 6in tall , of a slim build and has a bald head .
he was last seen wearing khaki trainers and a dark blue padded coat .
he is known to have links to methley , great preston , kippax and castleford and also owns a caravan in the hull area .

documents.title: sheffield taxi driver raises £ 15,000 for teenager heart screening
text: a taxi driver from sheffield has raised £ 15,000 in memory of a teenager who died of sudden death syndrome .

chris hudson , 49 , completed his fundraising adventure at sheffield wednesday 's hillsborough stadium after he has walked 1510 miles in memory of kyle hancock , who suddenly died at the age of 18 to the syndrome .
the money raised will pay for young people to have an ecg to detect any abnormalities and reduce the risk of sudden death syndrome .

documents.title: pedestrian hit by truck on m1 slip road
text: a man is seriously ill after being hit by a truck on a motorway slip road .
police were called to a serious road traffic collision at junction 46 southbound of the m1 near to garforth at 05:01 .
they had received reports of a collision between a truck and a pedestrian .
the section of road has remained closed since and diversions are in place .

documents.title: m1 closure : diversions in place
text: the m1 southbound is currently closed close to garforth in west yorkshire .
that means big queues as motorists strive to find a way to work .
it appears , at the moment , that it may be closed for much of the morning .
if you are there or expect to be heading that way there is a diversion route in place .
below is the advice from the highways agency :

documents.title: snow ?
text: so , snow was forecast but many places have n't seen it - yet .
there is still a risk of snow later this morning - and my quick snow forecast below will give you more details :
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: m1 closed after accident
text: the m1 southbound is closed in west yorkshire .
it happened following a crash at around 05:00 this morning near to junctions 46 and 47 around garforth .
it appears it will remain closed for a while .
# westyorkshire we 're in the process of closing the # m1 s/bound , j47 - j46 , near # garforth .
early expectation is that the s/bound carriageway will likely be closed for several hours this morning while the emergency services deal with a collision .
@ twitterid

documents.title: two charged over 'christmas terror plot '
text: two charged over 'christmas terror plot '

documents.title: fire crews chop up sofa to rescue kitten
text: fire crews chop up sofa to rescue kitten

documents.title: trapped kitten rescued from inside sofa
text: a 12-week-old kitten has been rescued from inside a sofa after firefighters chopped up the piece of furniture with hacksaws and hydraulic cutters .
the kitten 's owners were `` very grateful '' after officers from north yorkshire fire & rescue service saved the pet on thursday afternoon at their family home in tadcaster .
emma clark , 30 , who owns the kitten with her husband stuart , said she was relieved to be reunited with the pet .
`` they absolutely saved her life , '' the 30-year-old mother-of-three said .
`` without them she absolutely would not be here . ''
it was a `` shame about the sofa ''

documents.title: body of woman found in church car park
text: the body of a woman has been found in a car park of a leeds church .
she was discovered by police in a parked car at the moortown baptist church just before 09:00 gmt this morning .
officers say her death is n't sus but they 'd like to speak to anyone who might have seen a dark coloured ford ka in the car park today or in the past 24 hours .

documents.title: warning to drivers as snow forecast
text: highways england has issued a warning to drivers to be prepared before setting out on journeys tomorrow because of a severe weather alert for the north of england .
with snow forecast for the early hours of friday morning , highways england said it would have gritting teams working around the clock to treat roads and keep them free from disruption .
an amber warning for snow will be in place across the north west , yorkshire and the north east between 04:00 and 11:00 tomorrow morning following a met office forecast of snow .

the agency said the routes most likely to be affected include the m61 , m65 , m66 , m6 north of junction 36 , m62 between junctions 21 and 23 , and the m60 between junctions 15 and 24 as well as the a69 , a66 old spital and a628 woodhead pass

documents.title: canine company for york hospital patients
text: dogs have been taken to visit patients on a hospital ward in north yorkshire under a scheme that 's being hailed a success .
the three dogs called otis , betty and rebus ( above ) have been taken on visits to york hospital once a week to provide a much-needed boost for patients .
doctors claim that time spent with a dog or cat increases levels of well-being hormones and helps combat feelings of loneliness .
the dogs are provided by the charity pets as therapy ( pat ) .
everybody loves it when the pat dogs come in , both patients and staff .
it lifts the atmosphere and takes people 's minds off their problems for a while . ''

documents.title: do you know this man ? police in york want him
text: cctv images have been released by police to identify a man they want to speak to in connection with an assault at a york takeaway .
police want to speak with the man ( above ) after a 20-year-old man was knocked unconscious in a mcdonald 's on blake street .
the assault happened at about 05:00 on thursday 21 december 2017 .

documents.title: officers make second arrest over death
text: a second arrest has been made by officers investigating a sus death in south yorkshire .
the 38-year-old woman has been arrested on sus of murdering a man in balby .
the un-named woman is the second person to be arrested in connection with the death of the man , thought to be in his 70s , who was discovered by ambulance staff last tuesday .
an ambulance crew contacted police at around 12:20 on tuesday 26 december after being called to a flat on low road in the balby area of doncaster .

documents.title: woman airlifted to hospital after selby accident
text: a woman in her early 50s has been taken to hospital by air ambulance after suffering a serious leg injury outside selby train station .
the woman was injured at about 8:50 this morning during a collision between a citroen berlingo and a ford tourneo .
north yorkshire police say the site has been closed to traffic while police carry out investigations .

documents.title: police want to find sean evans
text: police are looking for 33-year-old sean evans from rotherham .
he is wanted in connection with offences including criminal damage and breaching a court order .
mr evans is from the aston area of rotherham and police are advising anyone who sees him not to approach him and instead report any sighting to the police .

documents.title: swansea city appoint former sheffield wednesday manager
text: swansea city have appointed former sheffield wednesday manager carlos carvalhal as their new permanent boss .
player-coach leon britton had been in temporary charge of swansea since the premier league 's bottom side sacked paul clement on 20 december .
carvalhal , 52 , was dismissed by wednesday on christmas eve , with the owls 15th in the championship table .
the portuguese joins swansea initially until the end of the season with the option of an extension .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: online fundraising reaches £ 14,000 for victim 's family
text: an online fundraising page set up in memory of a supermarket worker who was fatally attacked in north yorkshire has raised more than £ 14,000 .
the page had a target of £ 1,000 which will be used to relieve pressures and help the family .
but five days into the fundraiser more than 770 people have pledged cash totalling more than £ 14,000 .
mum-of-one jodie willsher , 31 , died after being attacked in the aldi store in skipton last week .

documents.title: cyclist , 17 , dies from injures following collision
text: a 17-year-old cyclist has died in hospital after a collision in barnsley at the weekend .
the boy was taken to hospital on saturday , 23 december after colliding with a dark coloured dacia compass on shaw lane in carlton , barnsley .
he died in hospital from his injuries the next day .

documents.title: york residents warned after boxing day robberies
text: people in york have been warned by police to `` be on their guard '' after three robberies on boxing day night in the city .
the first happened on the footpath between scarborough bridge and aldborough way in york at about 20:25 and the second took place on holgate road a few hours later .
in both robberies two men in their 20s had their phones and wallets stolen by a man with a knife .
the suspect has been described as being in his late 20s or early 30s .
the third robbery happened at about 23:30 on holgate road when a man had his coat snatched from a man on a bicycle .
no knife was seen during the last incident .
officers say nobody was physically injured and they are treating the first two incidents as `` linked '' with the potential that the third may be connected .
anyone with information is encouraged to call crimestoppers on 0800 555 111 .

documents.title: man remanded in custody over aldi worker 's death
text: a bradford man accused of stabbing a supermarket worker to death has appeared at leeds crown court .
neville hord , 44 , of great horton road , bradford was remanded in custody until 26 january by a judge at leeds crown court today .
jodie willsher ( aged 30 , died after being attacked at an aldi store in skipton last thursday .
mr hord will next appear at bradford crown court .
there was no application for bail .

documents.title: biker badly injured in accident
text: a 28-year-old motorcyclist is in hospital with serious injuries after a collision with a taxicab on the morning of christmas eve in sheffield .
the man was on a white honda motorcycle on herries road before colliding with a vehicle at the junction with wordsworth avenue .
it happened at about 07:55 on sunday 24 december .
police say the vehicle 's driver was uninjured and are appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: funeral for meanwood crash victim
text: the funeral of a 24-year-old man who died in a crash in meanwood last month will take place today .
robbie meerun was one of five people to die when a stolen car they were travelling in crashed in to a tree on stonegate road , meanwood , leeds .
a 15-year-old boy has admitted causing death by dangerous driving .

documents.title: traffic and travel : a60 closure after collision
text: south yorkshire police have just alerted us that the a60 is closed from tickhill up to wadworth after a road traffic collision :
due to an rtc the a60 is closed from tickhill up to wadworth .
traffic will need to avoid this section of the road .

documents.title: tribute for christmas day crash victims
text: south yorkshire police are flying their flag at half-mast today to mark the tragic deaths of 45-year-old pc dave fields and 61-year-old lorraine stephenson .
the two died following a fatal collision in sheffield on christmas day :

documents.title: bradford man to appear in court after supermarket death
text: the bradford man accused of stabbing a supermarket worker to death is to make his first appearance at leeds crown court today .
neville hord , 44 , from great horton road , bradford , is charged with the murder of 30-year-old jodie willsher .
the mother of one was attacked at an aldi store in skipton , leeds , last thursday .

documents.title: immovable cat among 999 calls
text: immovable cat among 999 calls

documents.title: south yorkshire hospitals made millions from parking charges
text: hospitals in barnsley , rotherham and sheffield made more than £ 5m from car parking charges in the last financial year .
the figures , which came from the press association , showed that sheffield teaching hospitals nhs trust raised the most cash from parking charges with the figure reaching just above £ 3m .
barnsley hospital made £ 1.3m and rotherham hospital made £ 912,000 .
the figures show a £ 400,000 rise in parking profits in comparison to the previous year .
no figures were available for doncaster royal infirmary .
the patients association said it 's hard to blame hospitals for trying to find money given the `` current state of nhs finances '' .

documents.title: listen : 'significant ' poaching problem in north yorkshire
text: police say poaching remains a `` significant '' problem for north yorkshire 's rural communities .
latest figures show they recorded more than 1,500 poaching incidents over a 12-month period .
inspector jon grainge , from north yorkshire police 's rural task force , says people should report anything sus

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: welcome to bbc local live in yorkshire on thursday 28 december 2017 .
we 'll be with you until 16:00 with all the latest news , travel , sport and weather updates from across the region .
to get us started this morning - here 's a weather watcher of a rather friendly and hungry robin .
if you 've got anything you 'd like to share with us today then send it to us by clicking here .
author: Rob Rose
BBC Yorkshire Live

documents.title: pc and woman killed in crash named
text: pc and woman killed in crash named

documents.title: our five top stories today
text: that 's all from us for today , we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for yorkshire .
updates on breaking news will continue throughout the night , but before we go , let 's look back at some of our top stories from today :
see you tomorrow .
if you want to keep an eye on the weather you can find out your local forecast here .

documents.title: £ 500 reward following theft of 'unique ' keys in york
text: a family visiting york from london are offering a £ 500 reward for information leading to the recovery of a `` unique set of keys . ''
their car was parked on nunthorpe road in york last night when it was broken into .
police say a large amount of personal property was stolen from their red ford focus estate .
the items removed included four identical family suitcases filled with clothing , large blue ikea-style carrier bags containing food , four crewsaver boating life-jackets and a set of buoyancy aids .
the family , stopping over in york on the way celebrate the new year in scotland , say they are particularly keen to recover a unique set of keys to their holiday destination .
they 're offering the reward for information about the incident to be passed to the police as soon as possible , including the recovery of the keys .

documents.title: how to 'a tractor ' lot of attention
text: if you 're in holmfirth you might want to keep an eye out for this bunch who are set to 'a tractor ' lot of attention this afternoon .
west yorkshire police say they 've `` gathered for a cruise in a holmfirth car park . ''
you might want to avoid the area , but if not perhaps just plough on !

documents.title: police officer and woman killed in sheffield crash named
text: a 45-year-old police officer and 61-year-old woman who died following a fatal collision in sheffield have been named as pc dave fields and lorraine stephenson .
mrs stephenson was a passenger in a silver citroen c3 , which was involved in the collision with the police car driven by pc fields on christmas day .
both pc fields and mrs stephenson suffered fatal injuries and were both pronounced dead shortly after the collision .
pc fields ' family said : dave was a loving husband and dad of two , who was a dedicated officer committed to his job . ''
the driver of the citroen , a 63-year-old man , was taken to hospital where he currently remains in a serious condition .

documents.title: leeds robbery victim threatened by five men
text: a 22-year-old man was robbed at knifepoint by a gang of five men in leeds .
the victim was robbed of personal belongings including his phone , wallet and bag .
it happened at the junction of railway street and wesley place at about 04.50am on sunday 17 december .
the victim 's bankcard was used a short time later in the briggate mcdonald 's where a man ( above ) was filmed on cctv .
anyone with any information which could assist the investigation is asked to contact leeds police .

documents.title: cremation works could mean longer journeys
text: bereaved families could be facing a longer journey or a wait for funeral services as york 's crematorium undergoes maintenance work .
cremations at the bishopthorpe site has been cut from about 10 per day , to five during december and january , said city of york council .
funeral services in the city are to continue but funeral directors may use cremation facilities across yorkshire .
it is not known when the building will be fully repaired said the council .
repairs are `` complex and involve altering the fabric of the building '' , it said .
a decision when to increase the number of cremations will be made once council officers are sure the problem has been permanently resolved .
pauline stuchfield , city of york council , said : `` the loss of a loved one is hard enough and plans are in place to make these arrangements as easy as possible '' .
although waiting times may increase demand is `` largely being met by the alternative arrangements '' , she added .
alternative crematoria include bradford , driffield , doncaster , hull , leeds , middlesbrough and scarborough , according to the council .
driffield and leeds are the nearest to york , with the rest about 40 miles ( 65km ) away .

documents.title: family of yorkshire woman jailed in egypt wo n't give up
text: the family of a woman from yorkshire , who 's been jailed for three years for smuggling painkillers into egypt , say they will appeal against her sentence .
laura plummer , who 's from hull , says the 300 tramadol tablets , which are legal on prescription in the uk , were for her egyptian boyfriend who suffers from back-pain .
she did n't realise they were banned in egypt .
the family 's local mp , karl turner , says he 's sure the british government will continue to press the egyptian authorities over the case .
mr turner says : `` this is a decent , honest , hard-working woman , who was simply naive '' .

documents.title: cctv appeal after bradford robbery
text: police investigating a shop robbery in wibsey have issued an image of a man they would like to speak to .
officers say two males , one carrying a metal pole , entered a convenience store on holroyd hill in bradford and made demands for cash and cigarettes at about 19:00 on tuesday 19 december .
they took £ 100 in cash before making their escape on foot .
a white volkswagen golf was seen driving erratically in the area moments afterwards .
detectives believe the vehicle could be linked to this investigation .

documents.title: walkies on the wards with christmas canine companions
text: a new scheme to cheer up patients spending christmas in a north yorkshire hospital is being hailed as a success .
three special visitors have been allowed on the wards to cheer up people who are feeling a little - wait for it - ruff !
rebus , betty and otis ( above ) are therapy dogs .
they 've been provided by a charity called pat , to cheer people up at york hospital .
the three canines stay on their lead at all times and are petted by inpatients and outpatients .
the hospital say the pooches are especially good at lifting the spirits of people with dementia .
doctors also believe spending time with a dog or cat increases levels of wellbeing hormones and helps combat feelings of loneliness .

documents.title: iron bar and knife used in doncaster armed robbery
text: a knife and iron bar were used in an armed robbery at a bookmaker 's in the armthorpe area of doncaster .
it happened shortly before 20:00 on thursday at the mark jarvis bookies in church street , just as the shop was closing .
the man threatened staff inside the shop , making demands for cash .
police say he left the shop with cash , heading towards beech road , and dropped the iron bar outside the shop .
officers say he 's black , about 6ft tall , of slim build and was wearing dark trousers , a dark sports top and had a navy blue scarf covering his face .
police also want to speak to a white woman , in her late 30s , about 5ft 5ins tall , of slim build with curly hair in a bun , who they believe was also involved .
anyone who saw or heard anything sus in the area is asked to contact police .

documents.title: listen : foul fowl complaints over tesco turkeys
text: a halifax family say their christmas day meal was very nearly ruined after a turkey they bought from tesco smelled so bad they had to put it outside .
lee ashforth says he had to dash about on a last-minute mission to replace the foul smelling bird .
tesco said it had sold hundreds of thousands of turkeys and had received a small number of complaints .
lee ashforth says the smell from the bird was terrible :
i wo n't be buying any meat from there again .
i 'd be amazed if anybody takes the risk next year doing that . ''

documents.title: missing york man found 'safe and well '
text: police say they 've found a man in his 20s who was reported missing from his home in york on christmas eve .
officers had urged the public to help them locate ross donaldson after they were concerned for his welfare .
the 26-year-old , is reported to have been found `` safe and well . ''

documents.title: robber threatens shop staff with cleaver
text: a masked robber brandishing a meat cleaver robbed a supermarket in south yorkshire .
the attacker , who was accompanied by another man with his face covered , threatened staff at the mccoll 's store on oaks lane in rotherham .
the pair made off with cash after the attack , which happened at 21:20 on tuesday 19 december

a police spokesman said : `` at this time there is no further information about the descriptions of the men and officers want to hear from anyone who saw , or heard anything sus in the area , at around that time . ''

documents.title: sheffield fatal crash fundraiser
text: a justgiving page has been set up to raise funds for the families affected by a fatal car crash in sheffield on christmas day .
the collision killed a police officer and a 61-year-old woman .
police are appealing for witnesses to the accident which happened at 08.15 .

a marked bmw 3 series police car was responding to an incident and travelling towards coisley hill , when it was involved in a crash with a silver citroen c3 on the a57 between coisley hill and moss way (
the 46-year-old officer driving the police car , was pronounced dead shortly after the crash .
the 61-year old female passenger of the citroen died in hospital .
the driver of the citroen , a 63-year-old man , was taken to hospital where he currently remains in a serious condition .

documents.title: ice fears close york bar walls
text: one of york 's most popular visitor attractions has been closed over fears of plummeting temperatures .
the city of york council have decided to lock the gates to the walls today , as temperatures begin to drop and put festive walkers at risk of slipping on ice .

documents.title: yorkshire 's wintry wednesday weather
text: early wintry showers should gradually clear coastal parts through the morning and early afternoon today , leaving all areas dry .
a largely sunny day is then expected , however it will be feeling cold with brisk winds .
tonight it 'll be cold , with the brisk breeze continuing .
it will also remain dry , with clearing skies and frost likely by dawn .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: man , 20 , dies after bradford crash
text: a 20-year-old man has died after a car crash in bradford .
the collision happened just after midnight on whetley lane , near to the junction with fairbank road in manningham .
a grey peugeot 107 was travelling along fairbank road towards the junction with whetley lane .
another vehicle , a grey vauxhall astra was travelling along whetley lane in the direction of toller lane .
the two vehicles collided close to the junction and then collided with two parked cars at the side of the road .
the 20-year-old was taken to bradford royal infirmary , but sustained fatal injuries and was pronounced dead .

documents.title: yorkshire 's winter wonderland
text: snow is making what we 're told will be a brief visit to the county so if you 've got young ones itching to get out in it , you should probably make the most of it whilst it lasts .
here 's a beautiful shot of keld in the dales .
and a cracker here of holmfirth , with the pot of gold indicator peeking out from beneath the cloud .
your snowy are welcome .
send them to us by clicking here .

documents.title: man found dead on christmas day named
text: man found dead on christmas day named

documents.title: man dies in crash near nostell priory
text: a 26-year-old man has died following a car crash in west yorkshire .
he was driving a peugeot 206 which collided with a ford kuga on wakefield road in ackworth near to nostell priory .
the crash happened at 11:23 on saturday 23 december .
the 26-year-old died at the scene .
his family have been informed .
the driver of the ford , a 59-year-old woman , sustained minor injuries .
det con deborah farley is appealing for people with information to get in touch .

she said : this incident has taken place on one of the main routes in to wakefield and i would appeal to anyone who has been in the area and seen either vehicle prior to the incident , or witnessed the collision itself to come forward with any information . ''

documents.title: delays on m62 eastbound
text: if you 're heading towards the m62 south of bradford be aware one lane is closed and there 's slow traffic due to accident eastbound .
it 's at j26 m606 / a58 whitehall road / a638 bradford road ( chain bar ) .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: murder arrest after man 's body found in doncaster
text: a woman has been arrested on sus of murder after a man 's body was discovered in south yorkshire .
the man 's body was found at a flat in low road in balby , doncaster at about 12:20 gmt on 26 december .
ambulance staff contacted police about the find and the death is being treated as sus said south yorkshire police .
a 33-year-old woman has been arrested on sus of murder and remains in custody .

documents.title: industrial action on rails : check your journey
text: if you 're catching a train this morning , be aware members of rmt union are undertaking industrial action which is affecting some cross country routes .
the timetable for todays 's services can be viewed here and a map showing how services will be affected , can be viewed here .
you can click on the links below to keep up-to-date with the live departure boards for :
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live in yorkshire on wednesday 27 december 2017 .
we 'll be with you until 16:00 with all the latest news , travel , sport and weather updates from across yorkshire .
what better way to start the day than a festive bbc weather watcher pic of a frozen robin .
we 're hearing there 's quite a bit of snow falling here and there around the county .
if you 've taken any of the white stuff you 'd like to share with the rest of yorkshire , send them to us by clicking here .
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire
